summary:
I am an Italian architect. With a background in Architecture and a Master degree in urban regeneration, I have started my professional life as an architect engaged in social planning and urban regeneration programs at the neighbourhood and city level  as coordinator of community-based development projects.
Along the years, I have developed an international experience in relation to the urban and metropolitan questions; first in the Netherlands at INTA – the International Urban Development Association currently based in Paris, then at IFHP ­- the International Federation for Housing and Planning, in Copenhagen. I have organized international exchanges and debates all over Europe, Asia and Latin America, aimed at seeking new understandings of today's urban processes, questioning urban policies around the world, at the different scales, and benchmarking diverse and composite approaches to city making. 
My interest is to keep challenging the complex urban and territorial development. I am curious about urban dynamics, co-creation, regeneration, community development processes, new urban concept in search of innovative and resourceful strategies in order to adjust planning instruments and policies accordingly. That is a bit broad but extremely fascinating. 
I currently live in Rotterdam, The Netherlands, where I have collaborated with the International New Town Institute (INTI) for which I have coordinated the Eu funded program “New Towns, Arrival Cities". 
In 2016 I was awarded the METREX Bernd Steinacher research Fellowship exploring models of metropolitan governance in the European context in dialogue with local and regional representatives. Since then she I developed my personal research on the observation of the contemporary landscapes transformation by using photography as a cultural and narrative tool for territorial analysis and community engagement, first as co-founder and author of the Urban Reports collective and later establishing the research group paesaggisensibili (www.paesaggisensibili.org) with the photographer Alessandro Guida.

profile_positions.description:
Urban Reports is a collective of architect-photographers and urban researchers who live in
different European cities. We use documentary photography as a tool to explore and describe
contemporary landscapes and promote a reflection on how territories are being altered and will
be transformed in the future, through the dialogue between different disciplines (urban planners,
architects, geographers, historians, economists, anthropologists, sociologists and landscape
designers) and the involvement of cultural institutions, public actors, professionals and the local
communities.
profile_positions.title: Co-founder

profile_positions.description:
The International New Town Institute (INTI) is a worldwide think-and-do tank, dedicated to improving the quality of design and planning of New Towns (i.e. planned communities) built in the 20th and 21st Century. INTI is a nonprofit independent organization and not necessarily an advocate or promoter of New Town planning. INTI takes an investigative and critical attitude towards the planning of New Towns. Knowing, however, that New Towns are an everyday reality for most urbanizing countries in the world, and are often seen as a necessity to house the expanding global population, INTI aims to exchange knowledge in order to improve the quality and livability of the thousands of New Towns – old and new – everywhere on earth.


In the role of project manager, I have been responsible for the project management, contents design and coordination for the annual events:
International New Town Day 2016
International New Town Day 2017 
Since 2017 I am responsible for the coordination of the 'New Towns, Arrival Cities ' project (2017-2019)
co-funded by the Europe for Citizens Funds. This project is a platform for knowledge exchange
between six European New Towns and three research institutes on the topic of migration, consisting
of 5 two-day New Town Labs held United Kingdom, Sweden, Italy, France and The Netherlands. My
role includes the contents design, supervision and coordination, support to the partners' activities
delivery, programme communication, reporting on the individual activities and on the achievement of
the final results.
More about the New Towns, Arrival Cities Programme: http://www.newtowninstitute.org/spip.php?

profile_positions.description:
I am honoured to be granted of the METREX Bernd Steinacher Fellowship for the period 2016-2018. Many EU metropolitan areas and regions are striving for more functional and effective governance systems. Adopting the approach of the metropolitan antenna, this research will look at a selection of metropolitan contexts, both Italian and International, with the aim to to understand what are the models and mechanisms of metropolitan governance in place and how do they work. 
Through a series of interviews and informal talks with a wide range of actors and stakeholders, at the different territorial scales, this exploration will lead to the elaboration of common questions and elements for reflection on the metropolitan dimension. The final objective of this research is the identification of common questions and reflections leading to knowledge exchange  and mutual learning at the European level.

Abstract: This research was a journey across Europe. It was a unique chance to informally meet and talk to the policy-makers, professionals and public actors who are called today to master the complexity of the territorial dynamics at the metropolitan scale. The understanding of "how the territorial reality can be aligned with the governance structures" is the goal of the many efforts undertaken so far and explored in this research. Why laboratories of metropolitan governance? Whether there is a top-down legislative framework that needs to be adapted and make it fit to the local and place-specific challenges and issues (Italian cases), or a special funding programme tailor-made for a target-region (Prague), or a voluntary and pragmatic political interest to achieve cooperation and play together (Helsinki region and Lyon Metropolitan Pole), each territory showcases an attempt, a strategy, a way forward, to deal with major territorial questions that call for radical changes.
profile_positions.title: METREX Bernd Steinacher Fellowship |  Metropolitan areas as Laboratories of metropolitan governance

profile_positions.description:
Torino Strategica is the association in charge of the Metropolitan Strategic Plan for Torino 2025. In the role of international antenna my task is to feed the association with insights and a wide perspective on the European metropolitan dynamics in place. 
By producing a reference framework for best practices, the main goal of the international antenna is to support the promotion of the plan and its implementation.
